AS3911 SPI IO
AS3911

This part of the AS3911 module provides access to the AS3911 via the SPI. More...

 Write to a continuous set of registers of the AS3911 using auto increment mode.

 Read a continuous set of registers of the AS3911 using auto increment mode.
s8 as3911WriteFifo (const u8 *data, u8 length)
 Write to the FIFO of the AS3911.
s8 as3911ReadFifo (u8 *data, u8 length)
 Read from the FIFO of the AS3911.
s8 as3911ExecuteCommand (u8 directCommand)
 Send a direct command to the AS3911.

Detailed Description

This module abstracts the SPI interface of the AS3911. It contains functions to read or write single registers:

  • as3911ReadRegister()
  • as3911WriteRegister()

to read or write a continuous block of registers in a single SPI operation (using AS3911 auto increment mode):

  • as3911ContinuousRead()
  • as3911ContinuousWrite()

to modify a register (performs a read, modify, write operation):

  • as3911ModifyRegister()

to access the FIFO of the AS3911:

  • as3911ReadFifo()
  • as3911WriteFifo()

to send direct commands to the AS3911:

  • as3911ExecuteCommand()

and to access the test mode registers:

  • as3911ReadTestRegister()
  • as3911WriteTestRegister()

All SPI data transfers are guaranteed to be completed after any of the function returns. But do note that the execution of a direct command might take some time to complete even after the transmission of that command is completed.

Function Documentation

s8 as3911ContinuousRead ( u8  address,
u8 *  data,
u8  length 
)
Parameters:
[in]addressStart address of the continuous read operation.
[out]dataSet to the content of the registers addresss to address + length - 1.
[in]lengthNumber of bytes to read from the AS3911.
Note:
The array pointed to by data must be large enough to hold at least length bytes.
Returns:
ERR_IO: Error during communication.
ERR_NONE: No error, continuous read operation successful.

Returns:
ERR_IO: Error during communication.
ERR_NONE: No error, continuous write operation successful.

Returns:

ERR_NONE: No error, Direct command send operation successful.
s8 as3911ModifyRegister ( u8  address,
u8  mask,
u8  value 
)

All register bits where the respective mask bits are one are set to the value defined by value. In boolean notation this is equivalent to: register = (register & ~mask) | value;

Note:
This is implemented via a read modify write operation.
Parameters:
[in]addressAddress of the register modify.
[in]maskDefines the bit which are modified.
[in]valueNew value of the bits selected for modification by mask.
Returns:
ERR_IO: Error during communication.
ERR_NONE: No error, register modify operation successful.
